availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Thomas Edwin Moore (Pendleton County, Kentucky, clerk and captain 4th KY Cav CSA)

body.p: Pendleton County, Kentucky, clerk and soldier. Pendleton County native. Son of William Moore and Margaret Sanford Braun Moore. Married to Sarah E. Shawhan in Harrison County, Kentucky, on September 9, 1859. Clerk of the Pendleton County Court in 1860. Owned one enslaved person in Pendleton County in 1860. Served in the 4th Kentucky Volunteer Cavalry Regiment (C.S.A.) as a captain from September 15, 1862, to April 30, 1865.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Pendleton County, Falmouth, p. 434.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Pendleton County, Falmouth, p. 1.
Kentucky Birth, Marriage and Death Records – Microfilm (1852-1910), KDLA, Roll #994037, Harrison County Marriages, p. 132-33.
Vital Statistics Original Death Certificates – Microfilm (1911-1964), KDLA, Roll #7017465, Pendleton County Deaths, file #17142.
Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky: Confederate Kentucky Volunteers War 1861-65, vol. 1 (Frankfort: Legislature of Kentucky, 1915), 608.
Confederate Southern Memorial Association, Confederate Veteran, Vol. 29 (Nashville: S. A. Cunningham, 1921), 434.
Find A Grave, "Thomas Edwin Moore (1831-1921)," Memorial #49045873, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/49045873 (accessed June 9, 2017).
